content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1045.5 - Prohibited uses

State Regulations

No person in the transit center or on a bus shall: (a) block free movement of another person or
persons, lie or sit on the floor or ground, or occupy more than one
seat; (b) create any unreasonable
noise by any means. Use of radios and other sound-producing devices in the
transit center or on a bus must be accomplished by means of headphones or
earphones and must be inaudible to others; (c) throw, drop or cause to be propelled any
object, projectile or other article at, from, upon, in or on the transit center
or bus; (d) drink any alcoholic
beverage or possess any opened or unsealed container of alcoholic beverage, except on premises duly licensed for the consumption of alcoholic beverages, such as a bar or restaurant; (e) consume or use any illegal or controlled substance on any bus or in any part of
the transit center, except pursuant to a valid prescription; (f) enter or remain in the transit center or
on a bus while his ability to function safely in the environment is impaired
due to the consumption of alcohol or the taking of any controlled
substance; (g) endanger the safety
of others, engage in fighting, or assault upon another person or persons or
threaten another person with such conduct; (h) vandalize, injure, deface, alter, write
upon, destroy, remove or tamper within any way any real or personal property or
equipment owned or under the jurisdiction or control of MSBA or its
tenants; (i) enter or attempt to
enter any area which is locked or otherwise restricted from public access by
any means, including, but not limited to, barricades, fencing, doors and signs, or enter or leave the transit center or bus except by designated entrance-ways
or exits; (j) park or stand a
private or commercial vehicle with the exception of emergency service or
sanitation vehicles, snow removal, or street sweepers on the transit center
premises; (k) skateboard, roller
skate, or ride a bicycle, scooter or any other self-propelled or
motor-propelled vehicle or device, other than by a physically disabled person, on or through any part of the transit center or bus; (l) cook, light a fire or otherwise create a
fire, except pursuant to the terms of any lease, license or concession granted
by MSBA; (m) dispense commercial
merchandise with or without charge, or carry on any other commercial activity
except pursuant to the terms of any lease, license or concession granted by
MSBA; (n) burn a lighted cigarette, cigar, pipe, or any other matter or substance which contains tobacco or any
tobacco substitute in any indoor area within the transit center or on a
bus; (o) offer or agree to carry
bags for hire or to flag taxicabs for hire; (p) enter or remain in the transit center
during nonoperating hours; (q) engage in noncommercial activities, except as authorized by section
1045.4
(d) of this

Part; or
(r) solicit money or
payment for food, goods, services, or entertainment. No person shall panhandle
or beg upon any facility or conveyance. Notes
